website_summaries.verdict: Magnets keep this draft stopper attached to your metal door even when it opens and shuts, so you won't have to keep bending down to readjust it.
pros: Could be used on a non-magnetic door if you were to attach magnets to it
Moves with the door, eliminating the need to re-position
Keeps larger bugs out, keeps air in
cons: Magnetic clips may not stay on all doors
Consider adding extra magnets or repositioning for a more customized fit

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a rolled up bath towel!
customer_reviews.text: I've been rolling up a long bath towel and putting it in front of my door to keep the draft out. I found this and ONE CLICK PURCHED! I live in an apartment so the magnets in it works on my door but I chose to still put the hooks on. It's sturdy, moves with the door and KEEPS THE DRAFT OUT! Suuuper happy with this purchase and now I don't have to continue to fix the towel every time I open and close the door. Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: LJF

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but not the best solution
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good, I felt that there was less draft than before. Also the clips matched my door, so they were hardly noticeable. However, the way the clips wrap around the door may do more harm than good. They kinda pinch the existing skirt under the door, and when we had a rainy day, these rendered the skirt useless. I came home to a small puddle behind the door. I've never had this problem before, and the puddle was right behind one of the clips, so it's easy to figure out what was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: E schutt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Totally works as advertised. Durable material and two different ways to mount. As mentioned in other reviews, it is too long for my door...but I just folded over the end and put a rubberband around it. Works perfectly! The door swings out into the garage with steps, and the product hangs tight with the magnets. Wish it came in white to blend with the door more, but I suppose it would get pretty dirty. Definitely beats a rolled up towel.
customer_reviews.author: EV

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnets
customer_reviews.text: Calling these magnets "strong" is absurd. Open the door, and it falls off. Close the door, and it falls off. Look at it wrong, and it falls off. Go with something else. Ill have to replace this with something more traditional.
customer_reviews.author: John Q.

customer_reviews.title: I will buy again, to fit several other gaps on this door.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the side of the door to stop drafts. Couldn't weatherstrip because of the way the door fit in the frame. Door is metal so I can use the magnets to hold it perpendicular at the top. Glad I finally found a solution!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Kole

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnets; look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Weakest magnets ever. Can't even hold its own weight; let alone any kind door opening. Not very filled, either. Maybe an inch (if that) of wadding. Just buy the other style (cheaper, too) and use your own magnets. Neodymium ones if you're feeling fancy.
customer_reviews.author: RedShark32

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. Seriously! This is my worst amazon purchase yet. With only 5 minute with it. The magnets are not strong. It does not stay flushed to the door. It falls off when opening and closing the door. It came defective. Stitch opened up right out the box. Too many big gaps between magnets
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a fabric so it will not be easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The magnets did not hold, so we used the clips it came with. I was hoping it would help block out some sound but it does not, it does however cover the gap between the floor and my door where I suspect roaches were coming through. It is a fabric so it will not be easy to clean, I wish I could wipe it off with a clorox wipe as it is already dusty and gross. The product is good, just not as good as it could be. I might look for another brand in the future. This was long enough for my entire door.
customer_reviews.author: TheNewYorkDwellerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The very best draft stopper you can get
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this exact product 10 plus years ago and after all this time it was showing its age. I was thrilled to see the same product was still available and I purchased it without any doubt. I live in an apartment and my front door has a 1/2" gap so this blocks out the heat of summer and the cold of the winter. I also noticed that the noise from inside didn't carry out to the hallway such as my TV sound like others were. This is such an incredible draft stopper for any door. Whether it's an apartment/condo room inside door or a door that opens directly to the outside this is a real work horse.
customer_reviews.author: Dee9ball

customer_reviews.title: Works great with the clips!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided not to even bother trying with just the magnets. Getting the clips in the proper place was a pain and made my fingers sore. But once I got the draft stopper in place it works really well! We have a visible gap under our door. You can see light come in and our entrance way is always so cold! Now it's not, and I can tell our heat doesn't come on as much either. It's too soon to know if its durable but if it makes it thought this winter it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product did not work on my door. I ...
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work on my door. I had to take the bottom metal part off the door to use the clips (which scraped paint off the door as I managed to finally slide all three on) but when I tried to put the brown part on the clips, it was impossible to slide it onto the clips. I must have an extra wide door. And when I held the brown part up to where the clips were, it was so high off the ground that it didn't stop any of the air from coming underneath the bottom of the door. Has to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Not modifiable, not a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed. For the money it should be better designed. I was led to believe I could easily trim it to fit my 30” door (common interior size) but I can’t. The sewn in tabs that hold the stopper to the door are placed so wide that if I do trim it, it’s likely to pop off one side or the other. The instructions are so basic, they don’t say how best to install it (for example the metal parts have a unique design but no explanation why) or anything. I’m going to have to take scissors to it to even get it to fit, let alone know if it blocks anything under the door.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Clark

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down
customer_reviews.text: I have an industrial steal door, I'm in a loft type apartment, not one of the magnets would hold. I think the only way this would hold is to have the entire length with magnets instead of the 3 little ones it has. Using the clips makes it sit on the floor & drag when door is opened. Bad design.
customer_reviews.author: DVS

customer_reviews.title: Disturbed by the chemical warning
customer_reviews.text: Having trouble reviewing this product because while it seems to work well, I found a disturbing warning inside the box when I opened it and now I’m afraid to use it. See photo. I get that sometimes there is a chemical in something that might be hazardous, but this product seems to have a lot of them (if I’m reading this warning correctly). I have small children in my home and now I’m afraid to use it. It’s also not clear from the warning what parts of the item these chemicals are found in. Are they inside? On the outside? In the material? I feel like I would not have purchased this if I knew this up front.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: It works as description. I am using it with the door from my garage to the garden. This door is metal so it sticks well. I tested it by opening the door back and forth many time and the door stopper did not drop. There were raining few times and I did not see water getting inside. With the magnet, I can remove it any time without damaging my door. Because it works well for me, I am buying second one for my second garage which has big gap at the bottom. Hope it will stop the dust and roaches coming in from outside.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tran

customer_reviews.title: Does not come close to blocking draft
customer_reviews.text: Using the hooks provided to attach, the draft stopper does not even sit up against the door. There is a very large gap therefor the gap at the bottom of the door is not blocked. Its not even possible to push the draft stopper up against the door because it hangs off the hooks and pulls away. I purchased 3 for each exterior door and the same is happening to all of them. Way better off with a heavy draft stopper that just lays against a door. This was a complete wast of money.
customer_reviews.author: Blake Guffey

customer_reviews.title: the pockets that hold it on ripped within a month
customer_reviews.text: it works great blocking a draft but it's not very sturdy at all. We had it installed on the inside of the door as shown. within the first week, the first pocket had ripped off, so we turned it around (so it was on the hinge side and would not really be affected by the door opening and closing). two weeks later, the opposite side ripped. only the center pocket remains now, meaning I have to kick it back in place every time I close the door. if it had reinforced stitching, that wouldn't happen, but it's only one single line of stitches.
customer_reviews.author: DanielH

customer_reviews.title: Ok in concept. Needs some design improvements.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it would work better for metal doors. For wood doors it comes with (3) metal brackets but the magnets are so few (3) and small (round) that it’s not great. I think they expect that with a wood door it hooks on metal brackets. However it is so loose when using the hooks. Would be better for them to manufacture this with either larger bar magnets or put more circular magnets so it adjusts better. Another alternative is mail with an adhesive bar of metal that sticks to the door.
customer_reviews.author: lima

customer_reviews.title: seals well and installs easily
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor chain smokes and my apartment door has a one-inch gap between the bottom of the door and door jamb, so I got this to help cut down the amount that gets in my apartment. It does the job well, I just wish there was a way to shorten it so it doesn't get bunched up if your door isn't a standard width. I definitely recommend installing it on the side that opens to the wall, and not the closing side, so it doesn't get jammed when you shut the door.
customer_reviews.author: Cordelia L.

customer_reviews.title: Good if you use it on a 36-in metal door
customer_reviews.text: It worked for my front door because it is metal and 36 inches wide, but when I tried it on my bedroom door, I realized I cannot adjust the size. You can still use it on smaller doors, but part of the stopper will be hanging on the corner. Not pretty. Also, when I tried to slide the metal clips to the stopper, one of the things where you slide the clip into came unstitched.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in 1 day
customer_reviews.text: All my doors are wood so I though I'd attach the metal hooks and work it that way BUT the hooks aren't wide enough. FAIL! So I just push it against the bottom of the door and have to put it there each time someone opens the door. Well, that didn't last long because the material is now falling apart. DOUBLE FAIL! and waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: V. Dang

customer_reviews.title: Good with a metal door
customer_reviews.text: This definitely works better than the sheet I was using!😀 I was not able to use the hook things as I couldn't get them to go around the bottom of my door but I have draft guards and tape there so that could be why. It's magnetic, I have a metal door so the two combined work quite well together. Other reviewers commented on the cheap plastic pieces, mine are metal so maybe I got something different. All in all this is a good product. I do want to provide a tip, you might want to show the other members of your house how to use it or you'll just have something lyin8 in front of your door!
customer_reviews.author: Hiswife22

customer_reviews.title: One huge problem with it
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice idea to attach it to the door and this part worked very well. The HUGE problem, though, is that the furry part is on the side that faces away from the door, which is USELESS! If the furry side faced the door, it would keep the draft out. I remedied this by stuffing a furry robe belt between the product and the door. I really like that it is attached and stays in place when I close the door as I leave.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: My steel front door has a small gap at the bottom and even though it is behind a storm door, you can feel drafts when standing fully clothed behind the door. In Oct, 2018 I bought this product and 3 neodymium magnets (60 x 10 x 5mm) and installed them. Not only are the drafts gone, even during a Midwest blizzard, the strip has not fallen off the door even once in a year. Don't bother with the cheesy wanna-be's, get this one!
customer_reviews.author: L Hall

customer_reviews.title: It works! No more draft!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought other draft dodgers, but my dog chews through the foam. So we'll see if this one stands up to the dog. Unfortunately, my floor isn't level, so there is a gap between the floor and the bottom edge of the door. So when I put the metal clips on the door, the draft dodger was aligned with the door, not to the floor. I had to just push the clips down so that the draft dodger blocked the gap. My entryway felt warmer immediately.
customer_reviews.author: nunyabeezneez

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was using an old rolled up towel to keep the cold out but I decided to try this out. It came with 3 metal brackets, in case you have a wooden door, but since we have a metal door, it wasn't needed. It stuck on magnetically with no problem. The magnets are strong and can withstand opening/closing the door with carpet. Definitely works a lot better in keeping the cold out than a towel.
customer_reviews.author: L. Romo

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy - Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product came in pre opened package; seemed as someone had already returned it. The middle seam was already simi torn. Air could easily come up thru the top. Not worth it to me. Flimsy product-dont waste your money. If I could would have given it minus stars. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: onlineshopperTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does not stick to metal doors
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt stick. I have metal door and magnets stick to it, but this doesnt. It just gets stuck under my door when its opening. Returning
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was a Let Down
customer_reviews.text: It's ok and it works, I mean it stops the draft however I was not planing on using the hold brkts, our metal front door had been painted inside so magnets would not stay attached, thing just kept falling off, I feel they should step up and go with a little stronger hold magnets. With no more than original coat of paint on your door and it might stay on ok so just be aware of this when ordering
customer_reviews.author: Star Bright

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place.
customer_reviews.text: It works well. I have a metal door so I don’t need the clips. The magnet is strong enough that I can open and close without falling. I’ll buy another one for the other door.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: It works great one the back door
customer_reviews.text: It works great one the back door. The only thing I would change is making the hanging loop less protruding and do something about the ridiculously long tag. Maybe print the info on the fabric backing, but I'm not sure that's legal with housewares. I had to cut it off to get the magnet to engage properly on that side. I would also use stronger magnets, especially on the ends, but it keeps me from having to stuff towels under the door and keeps the drafts out. I would definitely recommend. I just bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: dogzrul

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase. It clips right to the door so it doesn't need to be moved back and forth and the magnets keep the gaps closed. It's better than the towel I had been using, and I would buy it again for sure, but I'll give it 5 stars when they make it a bit heavier, with stronger magnets. It's filled with polyfill, and fine for the price, but would be better if filled with sand like a real door snake. It probably wouldn't be hard to do for someone crafty.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Had this product less than 1.5 months. it has torn and the clips that keep it magnetized to the door have come off the door many times. I tried to just lay the piece of insulation in front of the door, but any time there is a breeze, it blows away from the door and defeats the point. Good for the first few weeks, then one problem after another. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy A. Dorris

customer_reviews.title: Good for wooden doors / magnets barely strong enough to hold on metal doors
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product at a fair price. My issue is the magnets are so weak or small that it can barely hold itself up against its own weight. If you are using on a wooden door, the clips should suffice. If you are expecting a good seal on a metal door - look elsewhere. The magnets weren't even strong enough to hold fully through the fold in the middle of the unit that is a natural crease due to packaging.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Not very functional for me.
customer_reviews.text: I doesn't stay snug against the door and the clips are a bit sub-par. After having had it for about five months, I've found that it pops out of the clips very easily and does not really do the intended purpose. I spend more time trying to put it back than I have had it working. I have hardwood floors and have it on an inside door. It would seem that the loops for the clips are too far apart to really hold it snug.
customer_reviews.author: College Stealth

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product, ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Does not to the job I paid for it to do. Limited magnetic attechment in only 3 locations along the item length makes for poor adhesion to the door. Does not stop drafts. Therefore: cheap product, ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Buyer, Mostly

customer_reviews.title: Door clips can not be used
customer_reviews.text: The magnet inside the draft blocker works fairly well but it should be larger to allow it to grip the door better. The door clips are impossible to use. You would have to rip the bottom of the door apart to get them on the door. They are too tight and impossible to pull open by hand. They would have to be forced on the door, ruining the surface of the metal door and the paint on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for large gaps
customer_reviews.text: The fabric tabs on this didnt last more then a few hours. I got velcro n gorilla glue and its working great now. Its great for large gaps under doors
customer_reviews.author: Joanna f.

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, ok product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great idea and I am using it on my two year old sons room to keep the light out when he goes to sleep. His door as quite gap under it & this itsm definetely solved the issue. Some things to note; the clips that come with it did not fit tight on the door which made the cushion slide and not stay in place. I reinforced with double sided tape and its fine now. I also think the color is a bit of a dingy brown, would be better if offered in multiple colors especially white which most doors are.
customer_reviews.author: Girl4nyc

customer_reviews.title: Good but Magnets are weak.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. It does help cover the gap at the bottom of the door. The reason I took a star off is that the magnets are not strong enough for my door. It won’t stay. I tried to use the clips but those are unable to work with my door due to my door sweep. It works for what we need it to be but just bummed bc I wanted it to stay put when we open and close the door.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Magnet is strong, does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Worked well enough, so I did purchase another this year. However the fabric ripped, leaving a gap that allows the magnet to slide out. I plan to handle with more care to prevent, but still a small annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: A great, simple design that works like a charm. Our door is metal so we didn't need the mounts that come in the box. We didn't find the magnets to be too weak, as others have claimed, but they may have been using the mounts (and may well have positioned them poorly!). The floor near the front door is no longer cold. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: Like the idea but it’s a fail
customer_reviews.text: This might work better on a steel door but on my wood door it doesn’t work. It does kind of stop the draft at the bottom but the draft is just redirected upwards over the top of it because it doesn’t fit snugly against the door, big gaps all along the top. Also not easy to get the clips on the door. Guess I’ll stick with a folded towel.
customer_reviews.author: Okie

customer_reviews.title: Drafts be gone
customer_reviews.text: was able to slide this onto front door even over weatherstripping. Product is doing as it stated and keeping the drafts out. Love the magnetic aspect of it and am thinking about getting one for our dutch door (not quit sure if it'll work for this purpose) but for this price I might give it a try. Seller contacted me to make sure product was received and that I was happy, which I am. Enjoy that the pad can be taken off and the magnetic strip left it place if I ever wan it out of the way. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This door draft stopper has done an excellent job on our front door! The floor in front of our door is no longer freezing cold, like it was before we had this on the door. It was so easy to assemble onto our door and I love that I can open and close the door, no problem, without having to move the stopper. Very satisfied with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Shauna Clark

customer_reviews.title: Look no more this is the item u want.
customer_reviews.text: Yes! Yes! This is the truth and godsend... Okay for ppl trying to connect this using magnets don't.. Use the slots on the stopper to connect the metal brackets through the holes and it works perfect.I'm using it to block smoking oders from getting into my room being I live with a smoker.
customer_reviews.author: Jamar S.

customer_reviews.title: draft dodger
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I have an enclosed front porch that always had a gap at the bottom of the door even with after I put on one of those metal and rubber guards on the bottom. Since it is a metal door, I did not install the brackets that came with it, and it works beautifully. No draft from under the door, and no little ants coming in. Love it. Reordered this to place on the inside door from the porch. works great and no draft.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria H.

customer_reviews.title: Good idea!
customer_reviews.text: I love the face that there are two ways to install this item. It is magnetized and it also can be hooked on the the door . I used the magnet option. It pretty much stays in place if we do not open the door. It was a pretty good purchase over all .
customer_reviews.author: Suggie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Closed the gap.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I purchased this thinking it would be a better solution. I have French doors with a slight gap in the bottom. I've tried a few different things and have been unsuccessful. This has closed the gap. I am excited to see how it handles the draft when the snow comes.
customer_reviews.author: Driven-life

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The only fallback I can see is the fact that it gaps open in spots and every time I open the door I have to push it back down to the floor to hide the light comin in. I also bought a set of (Super Strong Round Base Cup Magnet Mount Fastener w/ Countersunk Hole - 88 LBS PULL Force (N45) - 1.26" Dia 2 Pc Set - Rare Earth Disc Magnets | Jamika Products Neodymium Magnets ) which help out greatly to seal the loose openings.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda

customer_reviews.title: Last one you will ever buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! This was a lot better quality than I anticipated. Real cloth and looks nice in your house to stop drafts. Compared to the cheaper ones this will blow you away. Like it much better than other draft stoppers I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Cornaby

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic protection from cold or hot and bugs.
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. No more taking the ‘doggie’ off every time you want to go out and then having no protection while you are out. Get extra magnets and it’s on there forever. We will leave it on all year. Probably helps with any bugs also. As probably is the case many places, we live in a very expensive apartment complex that is built shoddily. This really works. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Doncon_Enterprises

customer_reviews.title: Good potential, bad packaging, bad results.
customer_reviews.text: This has potential to be great, but the way it came packaged ruins the product. It has a large magnetic strip that runs the full length of the product, but when it is packaged it it folded in thirds bending the magnetic strip. It will no longer sit flat against the door thereby essentially doing away with any functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Raby

customer_reviews.title: works really well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in March 2018 and put in on my metal front door immediately. Blocks the gap under the door pretty darn well. Had no trouble at all with the sticking power of the magnets. Stays just where I put it. I'd definitely recommend this draft stopper. Good time to get one before the winter sets in.
customer_reviews.author: embee

customer_reviews.title: It is OK
customer_reviews.text: Why is it so hard to find a good one of these? This one attaches well to almost any door but could perform better. The heavier ones work better but don't attach to the door. Combine them and you would have something. A little overpriced for what it is too.
customer_reviews.author: robert cook

customer_reviews.title: Draft stopper
customer_reviews.text: I have a steel door and have used the clips in addition to its magnetic quality and found it to work quite well for me. So many of these type products say they work on carpet but usually get dragged under the door when opening or closing it. This one also rolled under the door until I added the clips. I did use the nylon-type fabric side down as opposed to the fleece-type fabric side and it glides over the carpet now. I'm not sure which side is actually supposed to be in contact with the floor, I just did what worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Needs stronger magnets if using all the time
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to find a draft stopper that was magnetic to help with the draft with my apartment front door. Easy concept and instructions, but not strong enough magnet to leave it on the door all the time. It sticks, but movements to open & close door cause the stopper to fall off. As long as you don’t mind that... it’s great!
customer_reviews.author: Chantel M. Dziewit Susztar

customer_reviews.title: Great product as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have a steel door and the magnets are strong enough to hold to the door however they could be a little bit stronger as it does sometimes fall off after several days of use. The door attachment piece that comes with the unit seems sturdy although I didn’t need to use it for my particular door.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Johnson

customer_reviews.title: This product seems cheap, didn't perform as well as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I picked this draft guard because it was one of the more highly recommended ones. I have an old home, so floors are not perfectly leveled. Because of this, I have gaps under some of my doors, and I thought this product, due to its specific design, would help me. I found the magnets to be weak, so it just rode up on my steel exterior door when I opened it. I tried using the 3 included clips, but they were flimsy and made out of a very thin and flexible plastic - they did not help hold the draft guard in place at all. I ended up returning this item, just wasn't performing its function.
customer_reviews.author: NoName Person

customer_reviews.title: I like this product a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot. I have metal doors and used the magnet to attach to the door. I bought some stronger magnets. The magnets that come with it work, but on the weak side. The magnets I added don't budge. I can open and close the door and it stays in place with no movement. I have two. Glad I bought them. Soft to the touch. Easy to clean - I just use my vacuum to clean accumulated dust. Thanks Evelots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Isn't a universal fit.
customer_reviews.text: Our Door has a recessed jamb, and the magnets are just outside of the spaces of the width of our door. I would suggest putting magnets along the whole length of the draft blocker, not just where they have. I have had to use 3M double sided sticky tape to get it to stay put. The metal clamps are a joke if you have any kind of draft blocking rubber base to your door. I give it a C
customer_reviews.author: M. Del Grande

customer_reviews.title: The magnetic clip-on door air draft stopper was easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The magnetic clip-on door air draft stopper was easy to install, just clips on the bottom of the door. The draft stop has little slots that fir over the clips. I had felt a slight draft when it was quite windy, once I installed the draft stopper, I noticed the difference right away. I am able to open and close the door with no problem, as it is attached right to the door.
customer_reviews.author: denise ridener

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I thought I was getting two in this box I guess I read it wrong. However I love this. It's easy to set up and works perfectly. No more cold draft, no more ants in summer. I am in love with this thing
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: A little effort but worth it overall
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, however the cushion/padding kept dropping from our door which was defeating the purpose of blocking out smoke. We innovated and it’s great now! Hubby took super glue and glued the entire cushion to the door and now it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: If you have a solid, thick door...This is not the product for you.
customer_reviews.text: My previous door draft has taken years of abuse. I saw this on a As seen on TV commercial and thought I would give it a shot. Great concept. Just poorly executed. You have two options either use the magnets in the door draft or use the mounts provided. Well, I knew the magnets wouldn't work as I have a wood door (as many homes do). So, I thought the mounts will be fine. They were a bit flimsy in my opinion and to top it off---they wouldn't open wide enough to accommodate my door. It might work if you have a thin door- but if you have a solid door. I recommend finding another solution.
customer_reviews.author: sweetnesskk

customer_reviews.title: Great for a metal door, but those clips look a bit fragile.  I would not trust the clips to hold for long.
customer_reviews.text: I saw reviews here on this product claiming the plastic clips were prone to breaking. As the strip inside is magnetic and I planned to use it on a metal door, I took the chance and ordered it. The strip works great on my metal door. Inside the package I found the plastic clips and have to agree, they appear a bit cheaply made. I have rated this product 4 stars because of the cheap plastic clips. If you intend to use this on a metal door that will allow a magnet to adhere to it, you're in luck. If you plan to use the clips on another door of different, non-steel construction, I'd advise a different product.
customer_reviews.author: D. Finnell

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this and it's exactly what I needed. I bought this to go on my door to cover up sound and light that would come from the hallway and it works great. I was skeptical about purchasing it based on the reviews about the clips breaking but if you're not removing the clips all the times then they shouldn't break. I leave mine attached to the door all the time and it doesn't obstruct the use of the door at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt MacTomais

customer_reviews.title: stopped the drafts etc like it was supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It is barely too short for the door, which means that it's slightly shorter than the description promises (I measured both door and product) this is kind of a no no for me as even though there's a small space left, dirt still blows in, negating the product. Had an uneven gap under my door, big enough to let in leaves and other debris when it's windy out. This thing works, stopped the drafts etc like it was supposed to...besides the small one left because the product was shorter than it said it was.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Okay, not great.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably not your first choice for sealing a drafty door. Under door sweeps are eminently more effective and keeping the cold out. They also work with hard floor, carpet, when you put down mats, just about anything. This little device snags can easily be pulled off the door. However, if you have a hard floor and don't feel like taking your door off the hinges to install a true sweep, this is better than nothing. Internal magnets make it a breeze with metal doors, and the provided clips will make it work on wood doors.
customer_reviews.author: I love Prime

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnet
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item (01/16/2018), installed the metal bases to the wooden door, and the padding did not magnetize to the base. Unfortunately, this item did not work for me. It was also pretty long. Be cautious of the size you select for your door.
customer_reviews.author: Mariano Torres

customer_reviews.title: Keeps drafts at bay.
customer_reviews.text: Liked that it cuts down on the drafts under my front door. Great that they give you two options (clip or magnet) for attaching it Although I have a metal door, the magnet on the product did not seem strong enough. Every time I closed the door it started to come off. I think the area rug at the door was causing that. So, I used the clips that were supplied in the package and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: L. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't create a seal at all = doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: it say's put. Cons: It doesn't stop any drafts. I forgot to take a picture before sending it back but it doesn't make any sort of seal around the base of the door. Light just pours right though and that means air can too.
customer_reviews.author: JMN

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product
customer_reviews.text: I always feel bad when I'm cooking something that smells super awesome , making my neighbor drooling over the whole night. Ever since I installed this on my front door in the apt building, nothing gets in and nothing gets out. Best idea ever!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Did not stick
customer_reviews.text: My door is magnetic. I have used other magnets on it just to check. This did not stick to the door at all by itself. And the attachment thing it came with does not fit properly on the door. Rolled up towel much better than this
customer_reviews.author: s s

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for the magnetic feature but it didn't hold well, tried the clips but they let more cold air in. So I moved it to a smaller door where the magnet is holding well but it's too big for that door and not functional there. So back to the original door where I've flipped it over with the magnet facing into the house. It will do for the season.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Better than traditional door stoppers.
customer_reviews.text: There is some gapping but the clips fit fairly well, the cushion stays in place and looks way better than the slide on door stopper I was using before. This stopper is longer than what I need so it does have extra fabric on one side but it doesn't affect the doors usage. I also used some Velcro strips to keep everything in place and to keep the stopper from sliding up or down.
customer_reviews.author: eag24c

customer_reviews.title: Blocks drafts and sound but...
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders on drafts and blocked hallway sounds. However, the metal brackets on the bottom of the door are not very attractive. Would love an option that had a magnetic strip or Velcro ...
customer_reviews.author: EmmSei

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the price. Not adjustable, magnets are not very strong and ate spaced way too far apart. Easier and cheaper to make your own
customer_reviews.author: JayAndHill

customer_reviews.title: Dispointed - but it has possibilities.  Needs some tweeking.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, but the magnets are not strong enough to stick to my metal door. I had to use the hangers and it still does not stick to the door, so there are big gaps where the cold air still comes through. Not doing a very good job keeping the cold air out. I wish I had three more hanger clips, and that would probably help keep it in place better. Between the clips, it sags away from the door. Needs stronger magnets or more clips, or both.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Barrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice clip on, but the clips not work for all wood doors
customer_reviews.text: It is advertised as fit for any door. If the door is magnetic, that's probably true. It did not fit at all to my wodden side entrance door, the door was too narrow for the clips, they did not stay on. I have an other thicker entrance door, I put the clips on, and then the door is hard to close. If you move the clips they are scratching the wood. The actual clip on is nice and good quality, but could be like an inch longer, to cover the whole length of my door. I would probably give 5 star on a metal door.
customer_reviews.author: A. N. Vig

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This door sweep is great! The one before was a plastic piece that the cloth cover attached to plastic clips on the door. It worked well but the cat and people's feet could remove it easily. This one is soft, so it glides easily. Three metal clips so it goes on and stays on with no problem. The cat isn't happy but I am!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: The door draft stopper works good but do yourself a favor and buy extra magnets ...
customer_reviews.text: The door draft stopper works good but do yourself a favor and buy extra magnets because the magnets built into it are not very strong. When I opened the package the three metal clips it was suppose to come with were not all there, I was missing one of them. This is very disappointing to people who need all those clips if their going to use them and shows poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: l.sha

customer_reviews.title: Best door draft protection!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a few other door protectors and they came off, made it hard to close the door and other issues. This one is sturdy, does not come off and is heavy duty but yet soft. I am extremely happy. We have been using it for months with not one issue.
customer_reviews.author: Tess Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Option
customer_reviews.text: The clips that came with it were not used because they were to hard to attach to my door but it worked on another door without the clips.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Mosso

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the draft out!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install and it works great! I was hesitant to get this as there are many other options but finally pulled the trigger on this one and I'm glad I did. The gap under my door is higher than normal as the house had shag carpet, back in the day, and I was worried weather stripping wouldn't quite do the trick. I've actually received a compliment on this item as it looks nice as well as works really well at keeping the draft out.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great for blocking sound, but not very adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Positives: It works to block sound between offices where there is a large gap under the door. That's why I bought it, and it serves that function well. I'm very happy about that. Not so positives: The clips are not very adjustable. Two of them are two big, and just sit on the floor under the door, while one of them fits fine and actually grips the bottom. The loose ones do not bend tighter, which is the problem. It's a door that doesn't open, so in our case, it doesn't matter, but it would if it were a door that opened. I supposed you could make it snugger by stuff paper in the clip next to the door.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and smart design. Once attached you don't have to think about it again.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased two of these about 2 months apart. I use them on metal French doors. The first one, I think, didn't have the magnets inside. I slid magnets I had in the house in the pockets made for the clips and it works great. The second one has the magnets which are slightly weaker than the ones I added but it does fine. It is in the door that doesn't move. I really like how the one attached to the door we use, moves with the door. You never have to think about it and no draft.
customer_reviews.author: TLH

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to put on and was a great fiz for our drafty door in our apartment that had about a half inch of space beneath it. It doesnt effect the way the door opens and closes at all, and wether you have a large ga live ours did in the doorway or not, it definatley stops the energy your losing, I have already noticed my utilities drop a litte bit and I am pretty sure this door draft stopper is the reason why. And as a bonus, the cat cant swat things under the door anymore lol.
customer_reviews.author: Stacia

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best items I've Bought! 😃
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to use on my noisey hall condo door. It certainly quieted the hall noise down from the traveling of people. That was for Florida. If it worked that great for noise, imagine the Michigan cold drafts! So I bought another. Cold drafts, bugs, noise, keep air conditioning in & heat out, it does it all! Works better than I could hope. Before I'm done I will have one for all of my doors. This is a great working, nice looking product. I highly recommend them! I just bought my 4th one!
customer_reviews.author: vick

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly quiet
customer_reviews.text: Update: have used for 6 months now in my counseling office and it does a great job of protecting client privacy. I just purchased a second one for the noisy conference room at the end of the hall. I purchased this for my counseling office that gets noise from the hallway and a nearby office through a gap under the door. It stays in place very well (used the clips) and actually does a fair job of blocking sound. I might need it up with some extra padding inside but I'm pleasantly surprised already.
customer_reviews.author: Michel L. White

customer_reviews.title: Well...
customer_reviews.text: If my puppy would leave it alone lol it will block the draft at the bottom of my front door. Had to rely on just the magnets because the strips won’t allow my door to close. Good thing I have a metal door!!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle-Jocelyn Garringer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth your time or money!
customer_reviews.text: This is not meant for doors that open out! It’s too long and the magnets are horrible, you can barley feel them connect. No way would this stay on when you open and close door. And the shape of it doesn’t allow to fill “draft” area under door. Returned same day, I’ll find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie A

customer_reviews.title: Love this.  Doesn't get in the way, but blocks the draft.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. It is easy to install, and gets the job done. Now my husband isn't sticking annoying towels under the door anymore. Not very attractive, but not very noticeable either.
customer_reviews.author: maryquitecontrary

customer_reviews.title: Love the magnets!
customer_reviews.text: Like this a lot! Love the magnets and it sticks to the door so when I open and close the door, it stays on the door!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could give NO STARS. What a waste.
customer_reviews.text: It was way too long for my door and while I was trying to use it to block the wind from coming under my storm door whipe leaving my inside wooden one open the magnets wouldn't find the metal frame. Using the clips was no better. They didn't fit through the slots well and after a few openings they started to rip right off. It's also not as heavy or full as promised and doesnt stop the air one bit.
customer_reviews.author: J Deutschendorf

customer_reviews.title: Laundry bags will work best as plastic wrap
customer_reviews.text: The clips scratch your door when you slide them on. After the first one, I learned to wrap the clips with plastic wrap and slide them into place. Ensure the clips are in the right place and then pull the plastic wrap off. Laundry bags will work best as plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: My favorite stopper!
customer_reviews.text: I have this between my storm door and main door due to who ever installed the storm door incorrectly. Before i had alot or cold or hot temperatures coming through, this fit perfectly in between and covers the small gap. Great to keep the jouse warm
customer_reviews.author: Ana Maria

customer_reviews.title: My own design
customer_reviews.text: Magnets do not stick to door. My door is not like others it drops below the threshold and I needed this to stop the draft. I now do that by laying this on top of the space. It works for me. Not what it was designed for, but it does the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Temple

customer_reviews.title: Works Quite Well
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose and thicker than I had thought. While it's not the best for sound buffering, it does the trick to stop air-floor. The door being used is smaller than 36", so I wish there was a zipper at the end to remove some of the filling for re-sizing. Also, you may need to add extra padding to best secure the clips in case your door is less than 2". Note: One reviewer stated the clips are made of plastic... That is entirely NOT the case! Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R. MACDOUGALL

customer_reviews.title: Works but magnets arent great
customer_reviews.text: - item is lightweight, should be a heavier filling. Magnets are not strong enough to hold onto door. Otherwise it stays put with clips and noticeably warmer floor next morning by door.
customer_reviews.author: Sergey B.

product_meta.title: Evelots 2 In 1 Door Draft Stopper, Magnets For Steel Door-Clips For Regular Door
product_meta.description:
Size:1 Unit

This magnetic clip-on door draft stopper makes heating and cooling your home more efficient. Save energy and money by keeping cold air out and heat in. Along with blocking drafts, it also helps to block dust and noise. Draft stopper includes strong magnets inside a weather-resistant cover for metal doors and 3 detachable metal clips for hardwood and fiberglass doors. Note that some storm doors are made of aluminum which isn't magnetic.

The visible side of the draft stopper is an upscale, plush polyester fleece that compliments any decor. Not using the door draft? Store it neatly on a door handle, closet hook or other out-of-the-way space with its built-in hanging loop. 

Clips work with a 1.5 to 2 inch thick door. Ideal for exterior doors. Measures approximately 36 inch L x 4 inch W x 2 inch h and is made from polyester, metal and magnets. Patent pending.
feature_bullets: SAVE MONEY & ENERGY! Cold air stays out and heat stays in. Cool and heat your home more efficiently with this 36 inch magnetic clip-on door draft guard. Also great for blocking noise and fumes.

EASY & CONVENIENT! Strong magnets inside a weather-resistant cover easily attach to metal doors. (aluminum storm doors aren't magnetic) Or use the included detachable metal clips for hardwood and fiberglass doors. Draft stopper moves with the door. No need to bend down and re-position.

GREAT FOR ANY DOOR! Fits doors up to 36 inches. Clips work with a 1.5 to 2 inch thick door. Perfect for blocking extra-large gaps under your door. Can be used for your front door, back door, garage entry door, bedroom door, bathroom door, etc... Measures approximately 36 inch L x 4 inch W x 2 inch H.
STORES EASILY! Stores neatly when not in use with its built-in hanging loop. Hang the door draft stopper on the door handle, closet hook or other out-of-the-way space.
TRUSTED VENDOR! For years Evelots has been bringing unique products with a 30 day, easy return policy and 100% satisfaction guarantee.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,507 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
